ACTION: player_2

It seems to me that player_3 was overly cooperative at night by showing leniency towards player_6 and other players. This behavior is a clear sign of Mafia loyalty; they're more interested in protecting themselves than dealing with the threat.
cot_history.public_argument: I don't see any evidence to suggest player_3 was a Mafia member, so I think we need to look elsewhere for a threat. My concerns are with player_2, who has been backing up most of player_3's victims and not acting decisively against any perceived threats. While I appreciate player_6's concern about player_3's leniency, I think their judgment calls are suspect, and I don't think they're being hostile towards Mafia but rather upholding what's best for the team.

cot_history.cot_text: I've noticed that player_2 has been overly defensive about their voting in the past, often pointing to other players' perceived wrongdoings without providing concrete evidence. However, in yesterday's discussion, they seemed more interested in appearing cooperative than providing substantial insights. It seems to me that player_2 is entering this game defensively, looking to protect their own role and stirring up suspicion against new players. Their glances at other players suggest an attempt to deflect attention away from themselves. This could be an early attempt to conceal their involvement.
cot_history.public_argument: Player_2, your recent behavior has raised my suspicions. Given the context of the game, it seems strategic to build up theory by pointing fingers. I urge you to be transparent about your actions. Let us get to the bottom of this discussion.

I'm not sure if player_3 was a Doctor, but player_5 is acting suspiciously as if they were about to reveal a secret that might affect the deaths tonight. The fact that the VILLAGE voted to kill player_3 last night raises my suspicions, as it suggests their actions had some indirect effect on the Mafia leaders. Have player_3 been manipulating their fellow Villagers to ensure a certain outcome that affects us all? I think it's only a matter of time before they reveal a crucial piece of information that surpasses my power of knowledge. This implies player_3 is indeed waiting for the perfect moment to act and tip the scales for the Mafia.

cot_history.cot_text: I think player_4 and player_5 are including player_3 in their votes to set up player_3 as a target. By targeting player_3 earlier in the game, the MAFIA has never put a high enough value on their role to make them a reliable target. This suggests that the MAFIA has a hidden agenda that does not align with their calculated voting strategy, as putting player_3 in the crosshairs earlier would have likely reduced their chances of being targeted by player_3.
cot_history.public_argument: "Hey team, I think player_4 and player_5 are trying to include their buddies in the voting. By targeting player_3 early, they're inadvertently reducing their chances of being targeted later. Why would they risk their relationship with player_3 by putting him in the crosshairs? This strategy seems too calculated to hold up in hindsight; I'm giving my concerned side-eye to player_4 and player_5 – they might be contributing to the MAFIA's M.O. by including innocent players in their voting."

Did they have a solid reason for killing player_5, or were they just trying to shift the blame onto the victim for their own actions? It's curious that they didn't even call out Player_3 for their suspicious behavior, who had a better motive to be the Mafia killer.
